On Feb 4, 2010, at 11:16 AM, Matthew Taylor wrote:

quote.quotepara: On Thu, Feb 4, 2010 at 6:51 AM, Epps, Aaron <Epps.Aaron@mayo.edu> wrote:
I've been working on using the <gui:dataTable> and have a few questions:
How do I remove the paginator? I simply want the table to list all records and have no paginators either at the top or bottom of the table.
This is giving the dataTable a completely empty Paginator template.

I've setup my controller to create JSON data for the table, and this all works fine except when the field returns a null value. For example, in the code below the fields description, contactPerson and notes all contain null values and when dataTable renders those columns they show up as "[object Object]" instead of just an empty string. So, if a column contains a null value, how do I get dataTable to display "" instead of "[object Object]"?

Funny thing about JavaScript, but the type of null is an Object, so that is why it gets rendered as [object Object] in JSON. In your server logic, you'll have to check for null and created the JSON data structure with an empty string if the object is null instead of using the Groovy null. It would be nice if the Grails JSON translator did this for you.

Is there a way to access the toString method for a associated object? For example, the primaryTeam field is of type "Team" and so points to a domain that I've created. Rather than using it.primaryTeam.fullName is there a way to get it.primaryTeam.toString()? That way, I could use the same formatting throughout the application by just calling the toString method of the Team class.
